review_title: I could not have been more fortunate to work for the NHS in London
job_title: Mental Health Specialist Practitioner in London, England
pros: The NHS flexibility, professionalism, training, salary and the clinical level of expertise and delivery of services makes it one of the most reputable health services in the world.  Constant change provides an incredible range of professional, clinical skills.
cons: Some services for the NHS, in particular community ones, are sometimes funded, structured and re-structured by local as well as national government which demands high levels of comfort with constant change regarding services delivery.

pros: Medical staff truly care about the patients and want to help in any way they can. People here love the community and it shows in the work.
cons: There is absolutely no room for growth unless you play teachers pet with management (who know little to nothing about the function and actual programs going on). People are given one billion and one different duties and some employees have worked here for years with minimal raisesuper that don't keep up with inflation! Administration is condescending and make employees feel incompetent. Employees walk on eggshells fearful for their jobs. It's a sad situation because such good people are stuck there.

review_title: Wonderful Trust and perfect place to work
job_title: Resourcing Team Leader in London, England
pros:
Good benefit pack, including perks such as NHS discounts, Trust Benefits, special rewards such as 2 extra days of annual leave if you have not been sick for the entire year, holidays of a lifetime (you can accumulate a few days of annual leave and after a few years, you can take all of them together for an exceptionally length of time to travel the world for a a couple of months).
Very helpful teams (learning and development, recruitment, HR, workforce/payroll, finance, people participation, nurses, ...)
I have worked for another NHS Trust and the different is enormous. East London NHS Foundation Trust is well ahead of other NHS Trust.
cons: The Trust could do much better with their offer of internal training or subsidised external training to help and support current employees to develop their careers.

review_title: Good trust marred by some backward thinking managers
pros: Generally the company culture is good - people are friendly, keen to get on etc. Like any NHS Trust, it has its challenges but it generally seems to face up to those challenges with a positive attitude
cons: Mainly, I rarely felt listened to. The Trust had its set ways of doing things when I arrived and weren't likely to change. To make any change whatsoever, you had to bang your head against a brick wall in the hope that it changed before you got tired.

review_title: Quite a discriminatory, borderline racist trust
pros:
They do long days
Lots of patient involvement.
cons:
Don’t expect opportunities or promotions if you are not white. 
The ward staff are becoming overwhelmingly ‘white’ which does not reflect the patient groups.
Fantastic BME managers/matrons have left due to lack of promotion.
Very poor representation of BME staff in bands 7 8 and above. 
It’s an oppressive trust due to the above.

review_title: Not good if you are a corporate employee
pros: Many opportunities if you are clinical staff
cons:
-Many temporary contracts, which just get renewed although they cover permanent needs
-Due to insecurity, the temporary staff deliver much more than they get paid for hoping that they will get a permanent contract

pros:
CQC rating “outstanding”
HSJ rating “top 10 employer”

I have had loads of great development opportunities./ secondments and moves around the Trust.
Benefits are fabulous - flexible working, discounts on play schemes is school holidays, additional days leave for no sickness, discounts in shops etc, refer a friend for hard to recruit post - and you receive an incentive. The benefits are endless.
cons: Fast pace environment - ever changing but every day is different (so a positive)

job_title: Mental Health Support Worker in Luton, East of England, England

cons: The challenge can be shortage of staff and as result have to work for long hours and as result it can be demotivating
